zebra-tc52.name: Zebra TC52 - Standard Config
recommendations: Increase quiet zone to 10X for Code 128
Disable aggressive scan mode for dense environments
zebra-tc52.notes: Most common warehouse scanner. Generally reliable but sensitive to quiet zone violations.

zebra-tc21.name: Zebra TC21 - Entry Level
commonIssues: Can struggle with UPC-E in poor lighting
recommendations: Use larger barcode sizes when possible
Train users on optimal scan distance (4-8 inches)
zebra-tc21.notes: Budget-friendly option. Good for basic scanning tasks.

honeywell-ct40.name: Honeywell CT40 - Aggressive Mode
commonIssues: May read through packaging to inner labels
recommendations: Configure scan timeout to avoid partial reads
Enforce strict quiet zone requirements (11X minimum)
Use 'aim and shoot' mode instead of continuous scan
honeywell-ct40.notes: Very sensitive scanner. Great for damaged labels but may over-read.

honeywell-ck65.name: Honeywell CK65 - Rugged
commonIssues: Heavier device, user fatigue in long shifts
Can be too sensitive in high-density storage
recommendations: Excellent for cold storage and outdoor use
Reliable for damaged or poorly printed labels
Consider wrist straps for extended use
honeywell-ck65.notes: Industrial-grade scanner. Highly reliable in harsh environments.

datalogic-memor.name: Datalogic Memor 10
commonIssues: Less common, verify WMS driver compatibility
Some firmware versions struggle with EAN-8
recommendations: Test thoroughly with EAN-8 if used
datalogic-memor.notes: Android-based scanner. Growing market share in retail/light warehouse.

generic-usb.name: Generic USB Scanner
recommendations: Test with actual barcode samples before purchase
generic-usb.notes: Budget scanners. Quality varies widely. Acceptable for low-volume operations.
